title-group.article-title: A Moving Mesh Numerical Method for Hyperbolic Conservation Laws

abstract.p: We show that the possibly discontinuous solution of a scalar conservation law in one space dimension may be approximated in $L^1(\mathbf{R})$ to within $O(N^{-2})$ by a piecewise linear function with $O(N)$ nodes; the nodes are moved according to the method of characteristics. We also show that a previous method of Dafermos, which uses piecewise constant approximations, is accurate to $O(N^{-1})$. These numerical methods for conservation laws are the first to have proven convergence rates of greater than $O(N^{-1/2})$.
